column4: Have you tried the instructions on the ubuntu.com download page?
Yes I have, to the letter.
They look to me like they shouldn't actually work, but for now I'm giving Ubuntu the benefit of the doubt.
why do you think the shouldn't work?
Because you can't magically convert a .iso image into a bootable usb image.
Steve Jobs wants us to believe in magic....
So I guess that begs the question, "What makes a bootable image, a bootable image?"
Ahh, I understand the directions now. They will only work if you're booting from an intel mac, they won't work for creating a USB that's bootable on a BIOS based machine.
Still not sure what that conversion is actually supposed to do, but that makes the instructions at least plausible.
Are you trying to make a USB for an intel mac or a BIOS based system?
Its an acer laptop
Ok. Do you want to try a combination of beta code and instructions that I can't actually test at the moment?
Why do you think the ubuntu instructions only work for an intel based mac, as opposed to a PC?
Ohhh Beta....
The Ubuntu liveCD images contain grub-efi, which be loaded via USB and a syslinux install that is only configured to boot from CD .
that would work, but unfortunately I don't have any CD-RW at home which is why I'm trying to create a bootable USB.
Its a major catch 22. In order to create a bootable USB I need a CD... Which if I had I wouldn't need a bootable USB. Irony....
Super GRUB2 DIsk beta..
This would allow you to make the USB from OSX.
sounds great...
Anything with a Super prepended to it must be awesome!
